intro: Standleyanthus triptychus, commonly known as the three-lobed standleya, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three distinct lobes and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
